<small>Hebrew form: **<big>[[H7612|שֵׁאת]]</big>**</small>
 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תְלַּתּ‎</span>] **noun [masculine]** ==a third part== (so [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תֻלְּתָֿ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תַּלְתָּא‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Nabataean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תלת‎</span> [[BDB#Cook|SAC]]<sup>121</sup>, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šulultu***</u></abbr> (= ***šuluštu***) [[BDB#Meissn|Meissn]]<sup>Suppl. 95</sup>, compare [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>WB</sup>; see also [[BDB#Marti|M]]<sup>88 \*</sup> [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>[[Dan.5.7|Dan 5:7]]</sup>); — emphatic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תַּלְתָּא‎</span> adverb ***as one of three*** [[Dan.5.16|Dan 5:16]]; [[Dan.5.29|Dan 5:29]] ([[BDB#Bev|Bev]] ***the third day***, every three days, see So in [[BDB#Marti|M]]<sup>88</sup> \*).
